correct_order: Indian thinking has traditionally been encumbered by a zero-sum view of the economy
A government that facilitated private business was assumed to be working against the interest of the workers and the public sector.
In reality, economic life is full of complementarities
I think even more urgent than privatizing existing state-owned firms is to allow the entry of private firms into sectors earlier reserved for the state

sources: Indian thinking has traditionally been encumbered by a zero-sum view of the economy
A government that facilitated private business was assumed to be working against the interest of the workers and the public sector.
I think even more urgent than privatizing existing state-owned firms is to allow the entry of private firms into sectors earlier reserved for the state
In reality, economic life is full of complementarities
